info.name: Medial eminence
info.description: The medial eminence is located in the floor of the fourth ventricle between the midline sulcus and the sulcus limitans.  This area overlies three pair of motor nuclei that make visible elevations in the ventricular surface.  These elevations are the facial colliculus (facial motor nerve fibers passing over the abducens nucleus), vagal trigone (dorsa motor nucleus of the vagus ) and hypoglossal trigone (hypoglossal nucleus).  Do not confuse with median eminence which is a portion of the ventral aspect of the hypothalamus.
info.item: /Gross/Brain stem & Cerebellum/Brain stem/8 Brain stem - dorsal view
